required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Facilitating Assessment of At-Risk Sailors Using Technology
clinical_study.official_title: Facilitating Assessment of At-Risk Sailors Using Technology

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Eastern Colorado Health Care System

collaborator.agency: University of Colorado - Anschutz Medical Campus

clinical_study.source: VA Eastern Colorado Health Care System

brief_summary.textblock: Randomized clinical trial with individuals being allocated to experimental (Cogito Companion) or Active Control arms. Those in the latter will receive information regarding widely available mobile self-help apps via a custom mobile app built in MyCAP. This same platform will be used to collect data regarding symptoms. Randomization will be stratified by gender, force (Surface, Aviation), and smartphone model (Android, I-Phone), as Cogito algorithms differ based on smartphone platforms. Participants will be willing Naval personnel being redeployed to CONUS. Data is also being collected (feasibility/acceptability) to inform future implementation..

study_design_info.masking_description: Outcomes measures will be collected electronically

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Treatment Engagement During Study Period
secondary_outcome.description: Review of Electronic Medical Records and Self Report
Review of Electronic Medical Record and Self Report

other_outcome.description: Changes on the Patient Health Questionnaire-9
Changes on the PTSD Checklist for DSM-5
Changes on the Beck Suicide Ideation Scale and Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale Screener; C-SSRS Screener

arm_group.description: Those allocated to Experimental arm will have access the Cogito Companion for a three-month period post-consent. Passive data collection will also occur during this period. As a secure, privacy-compliant mobile app, the Cogito Companion facilitates the non-invasive collection, transfer, integration, analysis, and reporting of objective behavioral indicators. The Cogito mobile sensing platform passively gathers behavioral information through an individual's normal smartphone usage. Measurements of location, call, and text patterns are recorded.

Participants randomized to the Active Control group will download MyCAP and have access to resources housed within this app for a three-month period post-consent. Participants will be provided information regarding the mHealth Tool apps, and provided basic information on how to download the apps. As noted above, participants will be provided biweekly surveys .

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: VA Eastern Colorado Health Care System
